Creates or deletes custom fields in the profile schema. To create custom fields, include a request body. To delete all custom fields, pass an empty JSON. 

> Each account has one profile schema. Updating it with this request will substitute the previous version.

data.description_suggestion: Creates, updates, or deletes custom fields in the profile schema. Include custom field definitions in the request body to create or update fields, or pass an empty JSON object to delete all custom fields. This operation replaces the entire custom fields configuration for the account's profile schema. Returns the updated schema with the new custom field definitions. Note: Each account has one profile schema, and this operation will substitute the previous version entirely.

data.current_description:
Creates new client profile.

You can send custom fields in the request body and they will be saved as part of your document. Therefore, the schema and examples presented below may differ from yours. Your integration must be adapted accordingly.

The `id` field returned by this request is the `profileId` used to retrieve information on a specific profile later.
 
Learn more about the [Profile System](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/profile-system) and its other API endpoints.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new client profile in the Profile System. Accepts custom fields in the request body which will be persisted as part of the profile document. Returns a Profile object with an `id` field (profileId) that uniquely identifies the profile and is used for subsequent retrieval and modification operations. Supports schema customization per store configuration. This operation creates a new profile record and makes it available for address, purchase information, and other profile-related operations.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity about what is returned and the side effects of profile creation. Added explicit information about the return value structure, the purpose of the profileId, and that this operation creates a new persistent record. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full lifecycle impact.

data.current_description:
Retrieves the information of a specific client, by its `profileId`.
 
> Since your store's profile schema is customizable, the schema and examples presented below may differ from yours. Your integration must be adapted accordingly.

> For security and privacy reasons, this request returns masked profile data. For unmasked information, see [Get unmasked profile](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/profile-system#get-/api/storage/profile-system/profiles/-profileId-/unmask).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves masked profile information for a specific client by profileId. Returns profile data with sensitive personally identifiable information (PII) masked for security and privacy compliance. For unmasked PII data, use the Get unmasked profile endpoint. Profile schema is customizable per store configuration, so response structure may vary. Use this endpoint when you need profile data with privacy protections in place.
data.reasoning: The description mentions masking but doesn't clearly explain why or when to use this versus the unmasked endpoint. Added explicit context about PII masking, privacy compliance, and guidance for AI agents on when to choose this operation over the unmasked variant.

data.current_description:
Deletes a client profile by `profileId`.

> This endpoint is not suitable for granting a shopper's [right to erasure](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/data-subject-rights--6imchxTx09icupKMbzHVIM#erasure). For that purpose, open a [support](https://help.vtex.com/en/support) ticket, according to the instructions in the section [Request erasure via support](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/erasing-customer-data--1R9Fn7A06Ifj4R9YD4JTKU#request-erasure-via-support) of the shopper data erasure guide.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a client profile by profileId, removing the profile record and associated data from the Profile System. This operation permanently removes the profile and cannot be undone. Note: This endpoint does not fulfill GDPR right-to-erasure requirements; for data subject erasure requests, contact VTEX support through the data erasure process. Use this endpoint only for administrative profile removal, not for compliance-driven data deletion.
data.reasoning: The description mentions the erasure limitation but doesn't clearly explain what the operation actually does or its permanent side effects. Added explicit information about permanent deletion, the distinction between administrative deletion and compliance erasure, and guidance for AI agents on appropriate use cases.
